trans-unit.source: Represents a dynamic entity collection that provides notifications when items get added, removed, or when the list is refreshed.
[!INCLUDE[ssAstoria](~/includes/ssastoria-md.md)] provides the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601> class to support binding data to controls in client applications.

This class inherits from the <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.ObservableCollection%601> class, which implements the <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.INotifyCollectionChanged> interface and is the primary data binding mechanism for Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) and Silverlight-based applications.

You can load an <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.ObservableCollection%601> binding collection by using any collection that implements the <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601> interface.
Items loaded into the binding collection must implement the <xref:System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged> interface.
For more information, see [Binding Data to Controls](~/docs/framework/data/wcf/binding-data-to-controls-wcf-data-services.md).
An entity type.
Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection`1"></xref> class.
By default, automatic change tracking is enabled for a <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601>.

You can create an instance of <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601> that uses manual change tracking when you create an instance using a constructor that enables you to supply a value of <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.TrackingMode.None> for <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.TrackingMode>.

When you use manual tracking, you must implement <xref:System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged> and <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.INotifyCollectionChanged> and handle the raise events to manually report changes to the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext>.
Automatic change tracking begins after items are loaded into the collection.
Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection`1"></xref> class based on query execution.
The <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601> collection of objects supplied for `items` is usually a query that returns the items in the collection.
However, any <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601> collection of the correct type can be supplied.
By default, automatic change tracking is enabled for a <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601>.

You can create an instance of <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601> that uses manual change tracking when you create an instance using a constructor that enables you to supply a value of <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.TrackingMode.None> for <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.TrackingMode>.

When you use manual tracking, you must implement <xref:System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged> and <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.INotifyCollectionChanged> and handle the raise events to manually report changes to the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext>.

A <xref href="System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceQuery`1"></xref> or LINQ query that returns an <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1"></xref> collection of objects that are used to initialize the collection.

Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection`1"></xref> class that uses the specified <xref href="System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext"></xref>.

Use this constructor to create an empty <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601> to which entity objects can be added without executing a query against the service or when an <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601> is not available.
By default, automatic change tracking is enabled for a <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601>.

You can create an instance of <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601> that uses manual change tracking when you create an instance using a constructor that enables you to supply a value of <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.TrackingMode.None> for <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.TrackingMode>.

When you use manual tracking, you must implement <xref:System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged> and <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.INotifyCollectionChanged> and handle the raise events to manually report changes to the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext>.
The <xref href="System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext"></xref> used to track changes to objects in the collection.
Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection`1"></xref> class based on query execution and with the specified tracking mode.
By default, automatic change tracking is enabled for a <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601>.

Use this class constructor and supply a value of <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.TrackingMode.None> for `trackingMode` to create an instance of <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601> that uses manual change tracking.

When you use manual tracking, you must implement <xref:System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged> and <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.INotifyCollectionChanged> and handle the raise events to manually report changes to the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext>.
The <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601> collection of objects supplied for `items` is usually a query that returns the items in the collection.
However, any <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601> collection of the correct type can be supplied.

A <xref href="System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceQuery`1"></xref> or LINQ query that returns an <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1"></xref> collection of objects that are used to initialize the collection.
A <xref href="System.Data.Services.Client.TrackingMode"></xref> value that indicated whether or not changes made to items in the collection are automatically tracked.

Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection`1"></xref> class with the supplied change method delegates and that uses the specified <xref href="System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext"></xref>.

Use this constructor to create an empty <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601> to which entity objects can be added without executing a query against the service or when an <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601> is not available.
By default, automatic change tracking is enabled for a <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601>.

You can create an instance of <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601> that uses manual change tracking when you create an instance using a constructor that enables you to supply a value of <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.TrackingMode.None> for <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.TrackingMode>.

When you use manual tracking, you must implement <xref:System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged> and <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.INotifyCollectionChanged> and handle the raise events to manually report changes to the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext>.
The <xref href="System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext"></xref> used to track items in the collection.
The entity set of the objects in the collection.
A delegate that encapsulates a method that is called when an entity changes.
A delegate that encapsulates a method that is called when the collection of entities changes.
Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection`1"></xref> class a based on query execution and with the supplied change method delegates.

The `entityChanged` and `collectionChanged` functions are invoked by the <xref:System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged.PropertyChanged> and <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.INotifyCollectionChanged.CollectionChanged> events, respectively.

The `entityChanged` method takes an <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.EntityCollectionChangedParams> value and the `collectionChanged` method takes a <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.EntityChangedParams> value.
Both methods must return a Boolean value that indicates whether the event was handled by the function.
When the method returns `true`, the default behavior still occurs.
By default, automatic change tracking is enabled for a <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601>.

You can create an instance of <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601> that uses manual change tracking when you create an instance using a constructor that enables you to supply a value of <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.TrackingMode.None> for <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.TrackingMode>.

When you use manual tracking, you must implement <xref:System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged> and <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.INotifyCollectionChanged> and handle the raise events to manually report changes to the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext>.

A <xref href="System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceQuery`1"></xref> or LINQ query that returns an <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1"></xref> collection of objects that are used to initialize the collection.
A <xref href="System.Data.Services.Client.TrackingMode"></xref> value that indicated whether or not changes made to items in the collection are automatically tracked.
The entity set of the objects in the collection.
A delegate that encapsulates a method that is called when an entity changes.
A delegate that encapsulates a method that is called when the collection of entities changes.

Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection`1"></xref> class a based on query execution, with the supplied change method delegates, and that uses the supplied <xref href="System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext"></xref>.
By default, automatic change tracking is enabled for a <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601>.

Use this class constructor to supply a value of <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.TrackingMode.None> for `trackingMode` to create an instance of <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601> that uses manual change tracking.

When you use manual tracking, you must implement <xref:System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged> and <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.INotifyCollectionChanged> and handle the raise events to manually report changes to the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext>.

The <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext> must be supplied when `items` is not a <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceQuery%601> or <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.QueryOperationResponse%601> that has a reference to a <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext> instance.

The `entityChanged` and `collectionChanged` functions are invoked by the <xref:System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged.PropertyChanged> and <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.INotifyCollectionChanged.CollectionChanged> events, respectively.

The `entityChanged` method takes an <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.EntityCollectionChangedParams> value and the `collectionChanged` method takes a <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.EntityChangedParams> value.
Both methods must return a Boolean value that indicates whether the event was handled by the function.
When the method returns `true`, the default behavior will still occur.
The <xref href="System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext"></xref> used to track items in the collection.

A <xref href="System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceQuery`1"></xref> or LINQ query that returns an <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1"></xref> collection of objects that are used to initialize the collection.
A <xref href="System.Data.Services.Client.TrackingMode"></xref> value that indicated whether or not changes made to items in the collection are automatically tracked.
The entity set of the objects in the collection.
A delegate that encapsulates a method that is called when an entity changes.
A delegate that encapsulates a method that is called when the collection of entities changes.
Removes all items from the collection, and optionally detaches all the items from the <xref href="System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext"></xref>.
When an item is detached, all related objects in the data graph are also detached from the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext>.
When `true`, detaches all items from the <xref href="System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext"></xref>.
Gets a continuation object that is used to return the next set of paged results.

The <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601.Continuation%2A> property returns a link that is used to access the next set of paged results when paging is enabled in the data service.
For more information, see [Configuring the Data Service](~/docs/framework/data/wcf/configuring-the-data-service-wcf-data-services.md).

When loading a paged result into a <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601>, you must explicitly load pages by calling the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601.Load%28System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%7B%600%7D%29> method on the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601> by passing the result of the execution of the URI that was obtained from the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601.Continuation%2A> property.
A <xref href="System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceQueryContinuation`1"></xref> object that contains the URI to return the next set of paged results.
Disables <xref href="System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext"></xref> tracking of all items in the collection.
The <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601.Detach%2A> method can only be called when <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601> is the root collection.

When the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601.Detach%2A> method is called on a collection that is a root collection, tracking is also stopped for all related objects in the data graph.
Adds a specified item to the collection at the specified index.

When you are manually tracking changes to the collection, you must override the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601.InsertItem%2A> method to prevent items from being automatically added to the collection.
Index at which to add the item.
The item to add.
Loads a collection of entity objects into the collection.

Calling the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601.Load%2A> method attaches all objects in the collection, if they are not already attached to the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext> that is associated with the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601>.
When an object is attached by using the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601.Load%2A> method, all related objects are also attached.
Collection of entity objects to be added to the <xref href="System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection`1"></xref>.
Loads a single entity object into the collection.

Calling the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601.Load%2A> method attaches the object, if it is not already attached to the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext> that is associated with the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601>.
When an object is attached by using the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601.Load%2A> method, all related objects are also attached.
Entity object to be added.
